page.title: 09Employment
page.content: The main employment is in farming, mostly full time permanent work.There is also casual work at fruit picking time, in spring and autumn with hops, and in the autumn with potatoes. One farm has a hauliers business attached. Apart from those who work on farms, others live and work in the area, these include: two florists with their own greenhouses, a landscape gardener and rose grower, a nurseryman, and the postmistress. Some are free lance with part time work elsewhere, such as two sculptors one of whom teaches in Malvern, and an artist who illustrates children's books and works in Malvern. Residents who work outside the area include: anaesthetist, nurse, two hospital ancillary workers, baker. and cook.A motor mechanic who owns a garage is probably the only person who comes into the area to work.
